definitions.definition: A form of fossilization in which the organic parts of an organism are replaced by minerals .
The breakdown of organic matter in the soil to form soluble inorganic compounds.
The deposition of calcium salts in abnormal parts of the skeleton .
The addition of minerals to water to make a mineral water .

main_definition: A form of fossilization in which the organic parts of an organism are replaced by minerals .
secondary_definitions: The breakdown of organic matter in the soil to form soluble inorganic compounds.
( pathology ) The deposition of calcium salts in abnormal parts of the skeleton .
The addition of minerals to water to make a mineral water .
